title: Are-we-fast-yet implementations in Oberon, C++, C, Pascal, Micron and Luon
summary: This repository provides additional implementations of the "Are-we-fast-yet" benchmark suite, a tool used for performance comparisons across different programming languages. The main "Are-we-fast-yet" repository is located at https://github.com/smarr/are-we-fast-yet. This specific repository expands on that by offering implementations in several other languages: Oberon, C++, C, Pascal (FreePascal), Micron, and Luon. Each language implementation has its own dedicated subdirectory containing specific details and instructions related to that particular implementation. The repository also includes the original README file from the main "Are-we-fast-yet" project for reference. Essentially, this repository aims to broaden the scope of the benchmark suite by providing implementations in a more diverse set of programming languages, allowing for a wider range of performance comparisons.
chinese_title: Oberon、C++、C、Pascal、Micron和Luon中的“我们够快了吗”实现
chinese_summary: 本仓库提供了"Are-we-fast-yet"基准测试套件的额外实现。"Are-we-fast-yet"是一个用于比较不同编程语言性能的工具。主要的"Are-we-fast-yet"仓库位于https://github.com/smarr/are-we-fast-yet。本仓库通过提供以下几种语言的实现来扩展该套件：Oberon、C++、C、Pascal (FreePascal)、Micron和Luon。每种语言的实现都有其专门的子目录，其中包含与该特定实现相关的具体细节和说明。仓库还包括来自主"Are-we-fast-yet"项目的原始README文件，以供参考。本质上，本仓库旨在通过提供更多样化编程语言的实现来扩大基准测试套件的范围，从而实现更广泛的性能比较。

title: We saved $500k per year by rolling our own "S3"
summary:
Nanit saved $500,000 per year by building a custom in-memory landing zone (N3) for their video processing pipeline, reducing reliance on S3's PutObject request fees and minimum storage duration. Their original pipeline used S3 for camera uploads, triggered Lambda functions for queuing to SQS, and video processing pods downloaded from S3. However, the cost of S3 PutObject requests at their scale (thousands per second) and 24-hour minimum storage for short-lived video segments became prohibitive.

N3 acts as a short-term in-memory buffer, with S3 serving as an overflow. N3-Proxy handles camera uploads, forwarding them to N3-Storage. N3-Storage queues the video for processing with a URL pointing to itself. If N3 is overloaded, N3-Proxy falls back to uploading directly to S3. A second fallback redirects all traffic to S3 if N3 is unhealthy.

The development involved synthetic stress tests and a production Proof of Concept (PoC) running in mirror mode. This helped uncover bottlenecks like TLS termination CPU usage and AWS burstable networking limitations. Key implementation details include DNS-based load balancing using Route53, network-optimized instances, Rustls for HTTPS termination, and optimizations to reduce outgoing traffic costs by disabling TCP timestamps. A memory leak related to stalled client connections was resolved by enforcing connection time limits and disabling keep-alive. The result is a cost-effective system that maintains reliability, strict ordering, and high throughput while minimizing S3 costs.
chinese_title: 我们自建“S3”每年节省了50万美元
chinese_summary:
Nanit 通过构建自定义的内存落地区 (N3) 为其视频处理管道每年节省了 50 万美元，从而减少了对 S3 的 PutObject 请求费用和最短存储期限的依赖。他们最初的管道使用 S3 进行摄像头上传，触发 Lambda 函数排队到 SQS，以及视频处理 Pod 从 S3 下载。然而，S3 PutObject 请求的成本在他们的规模（每秒数千次）以及短生命周期视频片段的 24 小时最短存储时间变得过高。

N3 充当短期内存缓冲区，S3 则作为溢出。 N3-Proxy 处理摄像头上传，将其转发到 N3-Storage。 N3-Storage 使用指向自身的 URL 将视频排队以进行处理。 如果 N3 过载，N3-Proxy 将回退到直接上传到 S3。 如果 N3 不健康，第二个回退会将所有流量重定向到 S3。

开发过程包括综合压力测试和以镜像模式运行的生产概念验证 (PoC)。 这有助于发现瓶颈，例如 TLS 终止 CPU 使用率和 AWS 可突发网络限制。 关键实现细节包括使用 Route53 的基于 DNS 的负载均衡、网络优化的实例、用于 HTTPS 终止的 Rustls 以及通过禁用 TCP 时间戳来减少出站流量成本的优化。 通过强制连接时间限制和禁用 keep-alive 解决了与停滞的客户端连接相关的内存泄漏问题。 最终结果是一个经济高效的系统，可在最大限度地降低 S3 成本的同时保持可靠性、严格的排序和高吞吐量。

title: Asbestosis
summary:
This blog post by Diamond Geezer reflects on the legacy of asbestos in Barking, London, prompted by the unveiling of a memorial to those who died from asbestos exposure. The author recounts the history of the Cape Asbestos Company factory in Barking, which operated from 1913 to 1968, exposing workers and even local children to dangerous levels of asbestos. The area became known for the "Barking Cough," a local term for mesothelioma.

The post highlights the long-term consequences, noting that the former factory site, now a council estate, still faces challenges due to asbestos contamination. The author then connects the issue personally, recalling his grandfather's work at another Cape Asbestos factory in Watford as an "Asbestos Moulder" and his premature death likely due to asbestosis, though it was never officially recognized.

He contrasts his grandfather's fate with his father's long life, attributing the difference to advancements in science, worker's rights, and health and safety regulations. The post emphasizes the importance of remembering the victims of asbestos exposure and advocating for safer working conditions. Ultimately, it is a personal reflection on loss, remembrance, and the enduring impact of industrial negligence, tempered by gratitude for the improved health and safety standards that have extended his own father's life.
chinese_title: 石棉肺
chinese_summary:
钻石吉泽的博文反思了石棉在伦敦巴金的遗害，缘起于纪念因石棉暴露而死亡者的纪念碑的揭幕。作者回顾了1913年至1968年在巴金运营的开普石棉公司工厂的历史，该工厂使工人和甚至当地儿童暴露于危险水平的石棉。该地区因“巴金咳”而闻名，这是当地对间皮瘤的称谓。

该博文强调了长期后果，指出前工厂所在地现在是一个市政住宅区，但由于石棉污染仍然面临挑战。然后，作者将这个问题与个人联系起来，回忆起他的祖父在沃特福德的另一家开普石棉工厂担任“石棉模具工”的工作，以及他可能因石棉肺而早逝，尽管这从未得到官方承认。

他将祖父的命运与父亲的长寿进行对比，将这种差异归因于科学的进步、工人权利以及健康和安全法规。该博文强调了铭记石棉暴露的受害者以及倡导更安全的工作条件的重要性。最终，这是一篇关于失落、纪念以及工业疏忽的持久影响的个人反思，并因健康和安全标准的提高而延长了他父亲的寿命而感到欣慰。

title: Eavesdropping on Internal Networks via Unencrypted Satellites
summary:
Researchers at the University of California, San Diego, and the University of Maryland conducted a study revealing a significant security flaw in geostationary (GEO) satellite communications: a large amount of sensitive data is broadcast unencrypted. Using a consumer-grade satellite dish, they passively intercepted various types of unencrypted traffic, including cellular backhaul data (calls, SMS, internet traffic, encryption keys), military and government communications (VoIP, vessel tracking data), in-flight Wi-Fi data (passenger browsing, flight information), VoIP calls, internal commercial network data (login credentials, emails, inventory records, ATM information), and critical infrastructure communications (SCADA, power grid repair).

The research highlighted that anyone with relatively inexpensive equipment could eavesdrop on this data. While the researchers contacted affected parties and verified remediation in some cases (T-Mobile, Walmart, KPU), the issue persists due to the lack of a single responsible entity and the perceived costs (bandwidth overhead, power consumption, licensing fees) associated with encryption. They advocate for mandatory encryption at every layer (TLS, IPsec/VPNs) and treat satellite communication links as unsecured public networks.

The study focused on GEO satellites and did not investigate LEO systems like Starlink, which are believed to be encrypted. Researchers emphasized the passive nature of their study and are offering assistance to organizations seeking to audit their network traffic exposure. They have also released open-source tools for others to analyze satellite data.
chinese_title: 通过未加密卫星窃听内部网络
chinese_summary:
加州大学圣地亚哥分校和马里兰大学的研究人员进行了一项研究，揭示了地球静止轨道（GEO）卫星通信中一个重大的安全漏洞：大量敏感数据以未加密的方式广播。他们使用消费级卫星天线，被动拦截了各种类型的未加密流量，包括蜂窝回程数据（通话、短信、互联网流量、加密密钥）、军事和政府通信（VoIP、船舶跟踪数据）、飞行中Wi-Fi数据（乘客浏览、航班信息）、VoIP通话、内部商业网络数据（登录凭证、电子邮件、库存记录、ATM信息）和关键基础设施通信（SCADA、电网维修）。

该研究强调，任何拥有相对廉价设备的人都可以窃听这些数据。虽然研究人员联系了受影响方并在某些情况下验证了补救措施（T-Mobile、沃尔玛、KPU），但由于缺乏单一责任实体以及与加密相关的感知成本（带宽开销、功耗、许可费），该问题仍然存在。他们倡导在每一层（TLS、IPsec/VPN）进行强制加密，并将卫星通信链路视为不安全的公共网络。

该研究侧重于GEO卫星，并未调查诸如Starlink之类的LEO系统，据信这些系统是加密的。研究人员强调了他们研究的被动性，并为寻求审计其网络流量暴露情况的组织提供帮助。他们还发布了开源工具，供其他人分析卫星数据。

title: WorldGrow: Generating Infinite 3D World
summary:
The paper "WorldGrow: Generating Infinite 3D World" introduces a novel generative method, WorldGrow, for creating infinitely large, explicit 3D worlds. This system provides an alternative to existing world simulators by generating walkable, coherent environments suitable for navigation and planning evaluation.

WorldGrow employs a hierarchical framework that starts with a single "seed" block and grows large environments through block-wise synthesis and a coarse-to-fine refinement process. This approach allows the system to generate coherent global layouts while also producing detailed local geometry and appearance. The generated scenes are intended to be navigable.

The paper includes examples of diverse generated scenes at various scales, including a large-scale indoor world showcasing reconstructed mesh and textured rendering. While the paper is released and the repository is initialized, the code is still under active development and preparation for public release. Pretrained weights and full training/inference pipelines are planned. The repository is marked with the expectation of changes as development continues. The authors encourage readers to star the project and cite the paper if they use any part of the repository. License details are to be finalized before the full code release.
chinese_title: 世界生长：生成无限三维世界
chinese_summary:
论文《WorldGrow：生成无限三维世界》介绍了一种新颖的生成方法WorldGrow，用于创建无限大的、显式的3D世界。该系统通过生成适合导航和规划评估的可行走、连贯的环境，为现有的世界模拟器提供了一种替代方案。

WorldGrow采用一种分层框架，从单个“种子”块开始，并通过块状合成和粗到精的细化过程来增长大型环境。 这种方法允许系统生成连贯的全局布局，同时产生详细的局部几何形状和外观。 生成的场景旨在具有可导航性。

该论文包括在各种尺度上生成的不同场景的示例，包括展示重建网格和纹理渲染的大型室内世界。 虽然该论文已发布，并且存储库已初始化，但代码仍在积极开发中，并为公开发布做准备。 预训练权重和完整的训练/推理流水线正在计划中。 存储库被标记为预计随着开发的继续而发生变化。 作者鼓励读者为该项目点赞，并在使用存储库的任何部分时引用该论文。 许可详情将在完整代码发布之前最终确定。

title: More big companies bet they can still grow without hiring
summary:
Here's a concise summary of the Wall Street Journal article "More big companies bet they can still grow without hiring":

The article highlights a growing trend among large companies aiming to achieve revenue growth without significantly increasing their headcount. Faced with ongoing economic uncertainty, high labor costs, and rapid technological advancements, these companies are prioritizing efficiency and productivity over traditional hiring strategies.

Several factors are driving this trend. Companies are leveraging existing employees more effectively, redeploying them to high-priority areas and upskilling them to handle new responsibilities. They are also investing heavily in automation and artificial intelligence (AI) to streamline operations, reduce manual tasks, and improve overall efficiency. This includes implementing AI-powered tools for customer service, data analysis, and even some creative tasks.

The strategy allows businesses to control costs and maintain profitability amidst economic headwinds. While some companies acknowledge a need for specific expertise in certain fields, the overall focus is on maximizing the output of their existing workforce. This approach can result in a leaner, more agile organization, but also raises concerns about potential job displacement and the need for workers to adapt to evolving roles.

Examples mentioned in the article likely include companies across various sectors experimenting with these strategies, illustrating the broad appeal of achieving growth through productivity gains rather than expanding the workforce. The long-term implications of this shift for the labor market and the future of work are significant.
chinese_title: 更多大公司押注无需招聘也能增长
chinese_summary:
以下是对《华尔街日报》文章“更多大公司押注不招聘也能实现增长”的简要总结：

该文章强调了一种日益增长的趋势，即大型公司旨在在不显着增加员工人数的情况下实现收入增长。面对持续的经济不确定性、高昂的劳动力成本和快速的技术进步，这些公司正在优先考虑效率和生产力，而不是传统的招聘策略。

有几个因素正在推动这一趋势。公司正在更有效地利用现有员工，将他们重新部署到高优先级的领域，并提升他们的技能以应对新的职责。他们还在自动化和人工智能（AI）方面投入巨资，以简化运营，减少手动任务并提高整体效率。这包括实施人工智能驱动的工具，用于客户服务、数据分析，甚至是一些创造性任务。

该战略使企业能够在经济逆风中控制成本并保持盈利能力。虽然一些公司承认在某些领域需要特定的专业知识，但总体重点是最大限度地提高现有员工的产出。这种方法可以带来一个更精简、更敏捷的组织，但也引发了对潜在的职位流失以及工人需要适应不断变化的角色等问题的担忧。

文章中提到的例子可能包括各个行业的公司都在尝试这些策略，这表明通过提高生产力而不是扩大劳动力来实现增长的广泛吸引力。这种转变对劳动力市场和未来工作方式的长期影响是重大的。

title: NORAD’s Cheyenne Mountain Combat Center, c.1966
summary:
This article details the history and purpose of NORAD's Cheyenne Mountain Combat Center, built in the 1960s as a hardened command and control center during the Cold War. The need for the facility arose from the vulnerability of existing above-ground centers to attack and sabotage, coupled with the increasing threat of Soviet ICBMs. The Cheyenne Mountain facility provided a secure, underground location with advanced technology for detecting and responding to potential air and space attacks.

Key features of the center included: hardened construction capable of withstanding nuclear blasts; duplexed computers and display screens to track aircraft, missiles, and satellites; independent water and power supplies; protection against various forms of warfare; and provisions to operate in a sealed condition for 30 days.

The article highlights the technological advancements of the time, such as the use of Philco 212 computers and large display boards for visualizing threats. It also describes the physical construction of the facility, including the use of springs and hydraulic dampers to protect the buildings and equipment from shockwaves.

The article shows the center's role in air and space defense, its capability to track space satellites, and its importance as a command post for directing defensive air battles. Pictures show the technology, the construction and important visits by dignitaries, including President Richard Nixon. While NORAD headquarters moved to Peterson Air Force Base in 2006, the Cheyenne Mountain complex continues to be used by military and intelligence agencies.
chinese_title: 北美防空司令部夏延山作战中心，约1966年
chinese_summary:
本文详细介绍了北美防空司令部（NORAD）夏延山作战中心的历史和目的。该中心建于 20 世纪 60 年代冷战时期，是一个加固的指挥和控制中心。建造该设施的需求源于当时地面的指挥中心容易受到攻击和破坏，以及苏联洲际弹道导弹日益增长的威胁。夏延山设施提供了一个安全的地下场所，配备先进技术，用于探测和应对潜在的空中和太空袭击。

该中心的主要特点包括：能够承受核爆炸的加固结构；用于跟踪飞机、导弹和卫星的双重计算机和显示屏幕；独立的供水和电力系统；针对各种形式战争的保护；以及在密封条件下运行 30 天的准备。

本文重点介绍了当时的先进技术，例如 Philco 212 计算机和用于可视化威胁的大型显示板。文章还描述了该设施的物理结构，包括使用弹簧和液压阻尼器来保护建筑物和设备免受冲击波的影响。

本文展示了该中心在空天防御中的作用、跟踪太空卫星的能力，以及作为指挥防御空战的指挥所的重要性。图片展示了相关技术、建造过程以及重要人物的参观，包括理查德·尼克松总统。虽然北美防空司令部总部于 2006 年迁至彼得森空军基地，但夏延山综合体仍然被军事和情报机构使用。

title: Tamper-Sensing Meshes Using Low-Cost, Embedded Time-Domain Reflectometry
summary:
This article describes a new, low-cost method for monitoring tamper-sensing meshes using time-domain reflectometry (TDR). Tamper-sensing meshes, crucial for protecting high-security devices, are typically monitored by measuring their ohmic resistance, a method that offers limited sensitivity and a challenging trade-off between sensitivity and false positives.

The author introduces a TDR approach leveraging inexpensive components (around 10€) to achieve high resolution (hundreds of picoseconds). The core of the system is an STM32G4-series microcontroller combined with DisplayPort/HDMI "redriver" chips (TI's TDP0604 and Diodes' PI3HDX12211) to generate fast pulse edges. These edges are then fed to a four-diode sampling gate using RF Schottky diodes, creating a cheap and fast TDR circuit.

This TDR approach offers a significant advantage by creating a "fingerprint" of the mesh's trace along its length, enabling more precise monitoring compared to traditional resistance measurement. The system's high sensitivity allows it to detect subtle alterations and even distinguish between identical meshes due to manufacturing tolerances. The paper details the circuitry, extensive measurements characterizing the system's performance and robustness against environmental disturbances, and its sensitivity to attacks. A preprint of the paper is available on eprint, and the source code is open-source on git.jaseg.de.
chinese_title: 使用低成本嵌入式时域反射技术的防篡改网格
chinese_summary:
本文介绍了一种使用时域反射计(TDR)监测防篡改网格的新型低成本方法。防篡改网格对于保护高安全性设备至关重要，通常通过测量其欧姆电阻进行监测，但这种方法的灵敏度有限，且在灵敏度和误报之间存在具有挑战性的权衡。

作者介绍了一种TDR方法，利用廉价组件（约10欧元）来实现高分辨率（数百皮秒）。该系统的核心是STM32G4系列微控制器，结合DisplayPort/HDMI“重驱动器”芯片（TI的TDP0604和Diodes的PI3HDX12211）来生成快速脉冲边沿。然后，这些边沿被馈送到使用射频肖特基二极管的四二极管采样门，从而创建了一种廉价且快速的TDR电路。

这种TDR方法通过创建网格迹线沿其长度的“指纹”而提供了显著优势，与传统的电阻测量相比，能够进行更精确的监测。该系统的高灵敏度使其能够检测到细微的改变，甚至能够区分由于制造公差而产生的相同网格。本文详细介绍了电路、表征系统性能和对环境干扰的鲁棒性的广泛测量结果，以及其对攻击的敏感性。该论文的预印本可在eprint上找到，源代码在git.jaseg.de上开源。

title: You already have a Git server
summary:
This article advocates for using existing Git servers with SSH access as a convenient solution for code synchronization, collaboration, and even simple web deployments. It highlights the ease of cloning repositories using SSH and pushing changes back to the origin.

The article addresses the common issue of pushing to a checked-out branch by suggesting the `git config receive.denyCurrentBranch updateInstead` command on the server. For publishing code via a web server, the article suggests cloning the repository via HTTPS.

To enable HTTPS cloning, `git update-server-info` needs to be run; the article recommends automating this process with a post-update hook. The example hook provided updates the server info automatically and even executes a static site generator to automatically publish updates to a website after pushing changes.

The author emphasizes the benefits of this approach, including local editing without network lag, automatic server-side updates, built-in backup and version control, and protection against accidental data loss. This strategy offers a simple yet powerful way to manage code across multiple devices and deploy static websites with minimal effort.
chinese_title: 你已经有了一个 Git 服务器。
chinese_summary:
本文提倡使用具有 SSH 访问权限的现有 Git 服务器作为便捷的解决方案，用于代码同步、协作，甚至简单的 Web 部署。它强调了使用 SSH 克隆存储库以及将更改推送回原点的便捷性。

本文讨论了推送至已检出分支的常见问题，并建议在服务器上使用 `git config receive.denyCurrentBranch updateInstead` 命令。对于通过 Web 服务器发布代码，本文建议通过 HTTPS 克隆存储库。

要启用 HTTPS 克隆，需要运行 `git update-server-info`；本文建议使用 post-update 钩子来自动化此过程。提供的示例钩子会自动更新服务器信息，甚至执行静态站点生成器，以便在推送更改后自动将更新发布到网站。

作者强调了这种方法的好处，包括本地编辑无网络延迟、自动服务器端更新、内置备份和版本控制，以及防止意外数据丢失。这种策略提供了一种简单而强大的方法，可以跨多个设备管理代码，并以最小的努力部署静态网站。

title: Wren: A classy little scripting language
summary:
Wren is a small, fast, class-based, and concurrent scripting language designed for embedding in applications. It's inspired by languages like Smalltalk, Lua, and Erlang, offering a modern syntax. The VM implementation is concise, under 4,000 semicolons, making it easy to understand.

Wren prioritizes speed through a fast compiler and compact object representation, allowing it to compete with other dynamic languages. Unlike some scripting languages with complex object models, Wren emphasizes classes. Concurrency is achieved via lightweight fibers, enabling program organization into communicating coroutines.

As a scripting language meant for embedding, Wren boasts no dependencies, a small standard library, and a user-friendly C API. It is compatible with various C and C++ standards. The article encourages readers to try Wren in their browser and invites them to get involved with the project.
chinese_title: 鹪鹩：一款优雅的小型脚本语言
chinese_summary:
Wren是一种小型、快速、基于类且并发的脚本语言，专为嵌入应用程序而设计。它受到Smalltalk、Lua和Erlang等语言的启发，并提供现代语法。其VM实现简洁，少于4000个分号，易于理解。

Wren通过快速的编译器和紧凑的对象表示来优先考虑速度，使其能够与其他动态语言竞争。与一些具有复杂对象模型的脚本语言不同，Wren强调类。并发性通过轻量级纤程实现，从而可以将程序组织成通信协程。

作为一种用于嵌入的脚本语言，Wren不依赖任何外部库，拥有一个小型标准库和一个用户友好的C API。它兼容各种C和C++标准。文章鼓励读者在浏览器中尝试Wren，并邀请他们参与到项目中来。

title: Researchers demonstrate centimetre-level positioning using smartwatches
summary:
Researchers at the University of Otago have successfully demonstrated centimeter-level positioning using smartwatches, a significant improvement over the meter-level accuracy typically achieved with existing GPS technology in these devices. This breakthrough utilizes advanced algorithms to process and refine the raw satellite signals received by the smartwatch.

The key to this enhanced precision lies in overcoming the limitations of standard GPS, which is often affected by signal interference and atmospheric distortions. The Otago team developed sophisticated software capable of mitigating these errors and extracting more precise location data. This involves combining multiple satellite signals and correcting for signal delays caused by the ionosphere and troposphere.

The potential applications of centimeter-level smartwatch positioning are vast, ranging from improved navigation for pedestrians and cyclists to more accurate tracking of athletes' performance. It could also enhance the functionality of location-based services, such as augmented reality applications and emergency response systems. Furthermore, precise positioning could benefit fields like agriculture and environmental monitoring.

The researchers highlight that this technology could democratize high-precision positioning, making it accessible to a wider range of users through affordable and readily available smartwatches. While further development and refinement are needed, this proof-of-concept study represents a major step towards achieving highly accurate positioning with everyday wearable devices.
chinese_title: 研究人员展示了使用智能手表实现的厘米级定位
chinese_summary:
奥塔哥大学研究人员已成功展示了使用智能手表实现厘米级定位的技术，这比现有设备中通常使用的米级精度的GPS技术有了显著的提升。这项突破利用先进的算法来处理和优化智能手表接收到的原始卫星信号。

这种增强精度的关键在于克服标准GPS的局限性，标准GPS经常受到信号干扰和大气畸变的影响。奥塔哥大学的研究团队开发了复杂的软件，能够减轻这些误差并提取更精确的位置数据。这包括结合多个卫星信号，并校正由电离层和对流层引起的信号延迟。

厘米级智能手表定位的潜在应用非常广泛，从改善行人和骑自行车者的导航到更准确地跟踪运动员的表现。它还可以增强基于位置的服务的功能，例如增强现实应用程序和应急响应系统。此外，精确的定位可以使农业和环境监测等领域受益。

研究人员强调，这项技术可以普及高精度定位，使其通过价格合理且易于获得的智能手表为更广泛的用户所用。虽然还需要进一步的开发和完善，但这项概念验证研究代表着在日常可穿戴设备上实现高精度定位的重大一步。

title: Books by People – Defending Organic Literature in an AI World
summary:
Books By People is an organization certifying publishers who champion human-authored books, safeguarding creative integrity in an era of AI-generated content. They aim to create a trusted "Organic Literature" market where readers can easily identify and value works written by humans.

Their certification process involves collaborating with publishers to verify internal systems, focusing on workflows, AI usage, authorship integrity, and editorial control. This includes a questionnaire, follow-up discussions, and a review of a sample of titles using expert analysis, editorial process checks, and signed declarations. Once approved, a formal agreement is established, with annual reviews to maintain standards.

Certified publishers receive the Books By People stamp, a certification ID, and a QR code for their profile in the Certified Publisher Directory, which can be used on book covers, metadata, and marketing materials. Additionally, publishers gain access to resources like an Organic Literature Publisher Manual, AI guidance, a legal playbook, AI monitoring materials, and optional advisor support. They also join a network of legal experts, and receive industry updates.

By joining the "Organic Literature" movement, publishers can secure the future of human authorship, maintain consumer trust through proof of authenticity, differentiate their brand in a saturated market, and strategically certify their organization. The Books By People team comprises experts in books, technology, marketing, law, and publishing.
chinese_title: 人民之书：在人工智能世界捍卫有机文学
chinese_summary:
"Books By People" 是一家认证出版社的组织，这些出版社致力于推广人类创作的书籍，在人工智能生成内容时代保护创作的完整性。他们的目标是创建一个值得信赖的“有机文学”市场，让读者可以轻松识别和重视人类创作的作品。

他们的认证过程包括与出版社合作，验证内部系统，重点关注工作流程、人工智能使用情况、作者身份完整性和编辑控制。这包括一份问卷调查、后续讨论以及对一系列书目的审查，审查采用专家分析、编辑流程检查和签署声明等方式。一旦获得批准，就会建立正式协议，并通过年度审查来维持标准。

获得认证的出版社将获得 "Books By People" 标志、认证ID和一个二维码，用于其在“认证出版社目录”中的个人资料，这些标志、ID和二维码可用于书籍封面、元数据和营销材料。此外，出版社还可以获得诸如《有机文学出版社手册》、人工智能指南、法律手册、人工智能监控材料以及可选的顾问支持等资源。他们还将加入法律专家网络，并收到行业更新。

通过加入 "有机文学" 运动，出版社可以确保人类创作的未来，通过真实性证明来维护消费者信任，在饱和的市场中区分其品牌，并战略性地认证其组织。“Books By People” 团队由书籍、技术、市场营销、法律和出版领域的专家组成。

title: Making the Electron Microscope
summary:
This article chronicles the evolution of the electron microscope from its inception to its current sophisticated form. It highlights the limitations of light microscopy due to the wave nature of light and the work of Ernst Abbe in defining the resolution limit. The discovery of X-rays and the subsequent development of X-ray crystallography by the Braggs provided a glimpse into atomic structures but was limited by the need for crystallized samples.

The crucial breakthrough came with Hans Busch's work on electron beams and magnetic fields, which demonstrated that magnetic coils could focus electron beams like lenses focus light, giving birth to electron optics. This inspired Ernst Ruska, working under Max Knoll, to develop the first electron microscope.

Initially intended to improve oscilloscopes, Ruska's work focused on optimizing magnetic focusing coils to sharpen electron beams. This ultimately led to the creation of a prototype electron microscope in 1931, which, though rudimentary, proved the concept. By 1938, it was used to capture images of viruses.

The article then details the advancements leading to modern cryo-electron microscopy, which can resolve individual atoms. While acknowledging the limitations of electron microscopy, such as the need for static, thin samples in a vacuum, the piece emphasizes its ongoing importance as a bridge between molecular structure and living function in biological research.
chinese_title: 制造电子显微镜
chinese_summary:
本文记录了电子显微镜从诞生到目前精密形态的演变过程。它强调了由于光的波动性导致的光学显微镜的局限性，以及恩斯特·阿贝在定义分辨率极限方面的工作。X射线的发现以及后来布拉格父子开发的X射线晶体学为了解原子结构提供了一瞥，但受到需要结晶样品的限制。

汉斯·布什关于电子束和磁场的研究带来了关键突破，该研究表明磁线圈可以像透镜聚焦光一样聚焦电子束，从而诞生了电子光学。这启发了在马克斯·克诺尔手下工作的恩斯特·鲁斯卡开发了第一台电子显微镜。

最初是为了改进示波器，鲁斯卡的工作重点是优化磁聚焦线圈以锐化电子束。这最终导致了1931年第一台电子显微镜原型的诞生，虽然简陋，但证明了这个概念。到1938年，它被用于拍摄病毒图像。

然后，本文详细介绍了导致现代冷冻电镜的进步，冷冻电镜可以分辨单个原子。文章在承认电子显微镜的局限性（例如需要在真空中使用静态、薄样品）的同时，强调了其作为分子结构和生物研究中生物活体功能之间桥梁的持续重要性。
